result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Scott Schalla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

*Court ordered restitution set at $0.00*

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Scott Schalla

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew Scott Schalla in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court reiterated the absolute sobriety and possession of no weapons order.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; and No possession of any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this case.

Defendant Matthew Scott Schalla in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/13/15 @ 1 PM
